intro: Webera gracilis, commonly known as the slender webera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, hairy leaves. It produces delicate pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Webera gracilis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
